headline.main: U.S. MAY TAKE OVER PACIFIC SHIP ROUTES; Washington Considers a Plan for Our Vessels to Free British Craft for Atlantic LONDON VIEWS AWAITED Meanwhile Britons Seek More Destroyers as Urgent Need to Guard Cargoes

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2 -- Washington was awaiting today the return from London of two United States Maritime Commission officials before proceeding further with the proposal for American ships to take over some British routes in the Pacific so that vessels serving the latter might be diverted to supplying England.
abstract: details including Kennedy's confs in London and Wash revealed
